channel.title: Slideshow script I wrote
channel.description:
http://jamesmonger.com/slideshow/
What're your opinions on it? I'll release when it's finished.

item.title: Slideshow script I wrote
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:8, topic:518321”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=636584.msg4291885#msg4291885 date=1367442677]

The javascript: links ensure that clicking anywhere on the tab will cause the slide to change, and the separate IDs are necessary to select the clicked slide.
[/quote]You don’t need the javascript: links and the separate IDs are not necessary at all. Look into query selectors or just simple loops. Your code and markup could be a lot more elegant and easy to use if you did this.

How else could I do it without the javascript links? Handle clicking with jquery?[/quote]Yes you could just attach event handlers to buttons or use hashes.

Read full topic

item.title: Slideshow script I wrote
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:7, topic:518321”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=636584.msg4291715#msg4291715 date=1367414570]
The javascript: links ensure that clicking anywhere on the tab will cause the slide to change, and the separate IDs are necessary to select the clicked slide.
[/quote]You don’t need the javascript: links and the separate IDs are not necessary at all. Look into query selectors or just simple loops. Your code and markup could be a lot more elegant and easy to use if you did this.[/quote]

How else could I do it without the javascript links? Handle clicking with jquery?

Read full topic

item.title: Slideshow script I wrote
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:3, topic:518321”]The javascript: links ensure that clicking anywhere on the tab will cause the slide to change, and the separate IDs are necessary to select the clicked slide.[/quote]You don’t need the javascript: links and the separate IDs are not necessary at all. Look into query selectors or just simple loops. Your code and markup could be a lot more elegant and easy to use if you did this.

item.title: Slideshow script I wrote
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

I’m not going to criticize the code but the markup needs work.

				<div id="slide1" class="item active">
					Spiderman
					<a href="javascript:changeSlide(1)">
						<span class="link-spanner"></span>
					</a>
				</div>
				<div id="slide2" class="item">
					Halo
					<a href="javascript:changeSlide(2)">
						<span class="link-spanner"></span>
					</a>
				</div>
				<div id="slide3" class="item">
					Grand Theft Auto
					<a href="javascript:changeSlide(3)">
						<span class="link-spanner"></span>
					</a>
				</div>
				<div id="slide4" class="item">
					Call to Arms
					<a href="javascript:changeSlide(4)">
						<span class="link-spanner"></span>
					</a>
				</div>

Do this without using separate IDs for each slide and remove the “javascript:” links.

Read full topic
